p: The transmission cycle of CHIKV requires the infection of female mosquitoes through a virus-containing blood meal and, following an appropriate extrinsic incubation period, transmission to another vertebrate host during subsequent feeding [ 1, 4]. The ability of CHIKV to bind human cells and to replicate in cell cultures was documented, and the general features are similar to other alphaviruses [ 45, 46, 47]. CHIKV is internalized into human target cells mainly as a result of receptor-mediated endocytosis involving clathrin-dependent mechanisms, delivering the virus to endosomes from which the viral capsid is released into the cytosol [ 48, 49, 50].
